intro: Pygeum preslii var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf African cherry, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, ovate leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing smooth, brown seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, particularly in treating prostate-related conditions.
